is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.stacks

Interface OperationTimeout


  • public interface OperationTimeout
    Encapsulates a simple expiration timer. Implementations are provided by buruberi.

    The stack will schedule() a timeout when it begins an operation, and unschedule() it when the task terminates.

    Important: OperationTimeout implementations are not guaranteed to be thread-safe.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String LOG_TAG

    • Field Detail

      • LOG_TAG

        static final java.lang.String LOG_TAG

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        void schedule()
        Called by GattPeripheral. Schedules a timeout timer.

        This method is not assumed to be safe to call until after setTimeoutAction(Action0, Scheduler) is called.

      • unschedule

        void unschedule()
        Called by GattPeripheral. Unschedules the timeout timer.

        It is a valid condition for this method to be called multiple times, it should become a no-op after the first call.

        This method is not assumed to be safe to call until after setTimeoutAction(Action0, Scheduler) is called.

      • reschedule

        void reschedule()
        For use by clients. Unschedules and reschedules the timeout timer.

        This method is not assumed to be safe to call until after setTimeoutAction(Action0, Scheduler) is called.

      • setTimeoutAction

        void setTimeoutAction(rx.functions.Action0 action,
                      rx.Scheduler scheduler)
        Called by GattPeripheral. Specifies an action to run when the timeout expires that will allow the stack to clean up any resources.

        Client code should check the state of a peripheral after a timeout has expired.

        Parameters:
        action - Stack specific logic to handle the timeout.
        scheduler - The scheduler to run the handler on.
